main event: On August 26, 1949, at 1345 hours, a special inquiry was initiated at Davis-Monthan AFB in Tucson, Arizona after the sighting of an unidentified aerial object by a reliable and experienced weather observer.
interesting points: The object appeared to be triangular with rounded edges and had a brownish-hazy color as it flew from the southeast to the northwest at an extreme altitude.
The observer estimated the object's distance at around 13.4 miles per minute, which equates to approximately 800 miles per hour.
The shape of the object was similar to a Convair XF-92A delta wing interceptor being tested at Muroc AFB, California at the time.
There were no observable celestial phenomena or planets that could account for the sighting.
The object executed no maneuvers or tactics and flew perfectly horizontally and straight with no sound.
sighted object: an unidentified triangular aerial object with a brownish-hazy color
witnesses: a reliable and experienced weather observer
photographs: no, the report does not include photographs
